result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra L Andrews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine to be paid at the rate of  $50.00 per month,  starting 02-01-2016 and the 1st of every  month until paid in full. 
Alternate: 5 days in the Waukesha County Jail.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Attorney Ponath.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Debra L Andrews in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.  
Court to Address - Competency Evaluation.

All parties have a copy of the evaluation conducted by Dr. Luzi.
Dr. Luzi's evaluation finds the defendant is competent.
Both State and Defense are in agreement to Dr. Luzi's Evaluation and not requesting a second evaluation.

Based on Dr. Luzi's evaluation, the court finds the defendant is competent to proceed.
Matter will proceed to Plea and Sentencing.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine: $505
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 02/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: 5  Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
